Improve Jekyll setup instructions (#274)

* Remove outdated guide

This guide is good but out of date, and the repo isn't being maintained.
The instructions we give should be current.

* Clarify wording

This is not something that the user needs to do separtely,
rather something that should have been included as part of the installation.

* Tell Windows users where to run commands

* Use more motivating language

Starting a section with 'optional' is going to make many people ignore it.
Local preview is useful to spot formatting errors etc.

* Encourage users to use their default Ruby version

Using the same version of Ruby as GitHub uses isn't essential,
and the pages can be previewed just fine using a different version.

Suggest users try the simple option first, but retain instructions for
installing a different Ruby version (but only for Mac/Linux).

Suggesting that users need a specific version of Ruby, but not giving
instructions on how to achieve this on Windows seems rather inconsistent.
